result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Paul Laumer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.
Defendant shall maintain full time employment. If not employed, seek work with at least three applications per week. Copy applications to agent.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such counseling as DOC deems appropriate.
Defendant shall submit to random drug testing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory Paul Laumer

records.addlTxt: All court appointed attorney fees assessed in 22CF47. Bond in this case applied to attorney fees in 22CF47.

Defendant Gregory Paul Laumer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Tripp Stroud appeared by video for Gregory Paul Laumer.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Stroud recently filed his proposed order for attorney fees.  Court questioned Defendant on his ability to pay the attorney fees. Currently in custody. Def lost his job. Defendant agrees and the Court orders def. to make monthly payments of $100 commencing 2/1/23.
All billing for court appointed attorney fees for this case filed in 22CF47.
Payment hearing on October 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gregory Paul Laumer in court.  Attorney Tripp Stroud in court for Gregory Paul Laumer.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant to plead to charge with three years probation, costs, DNA, counseling, drug testing, full time work or seek at 3 applications per week copying agent monthly. Per agreement, State will not file additional bailjumping charge. Counsel did not have time to complete plea questionnaire. Court orally reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Defendant pleads guilty. Felony loss of rights explained. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard. Attorney Stroud heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 3 years probation with conditions: court costs, DNA, counseling, random drug testing, full time work or 3 applications per week with copies to agent. Three days credit, if revoked.
returned from SO 9-9-22

Defendant Gregory Paul Laumer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Tripp Stroud appeared by video for Gregory Paul Laumer.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stroud and defendant go to breakout room and return. State requests $500 cash bond, each case. Attorney Stroud heard. Case expected to resolve. Bond set at $250 cash, each file, totaling $500. Status set.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Gregory Paul Laumer in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for SPD and will not be able to retain an attorney. Defendant should complete court appointed paperwork today. Status date set.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Status conference on April 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Gregory Paul Laumer in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. He works 20 hours per week at Carr Valley Cheese. He may be able to borrow money from his aunt for a retainer. State requests $100 cash bond. Defendant is agreeable to taking a drug test. Defendant states he would be positive for THC if tested today. Court advises defendant to file a petition for counsel if he cannot borrow money for an attorney. Defendant now states he will be positive for meth if tested today. Court does not order test. Bond set at $1000 signature with condition: Defendant shall submit to drug testing at request of law enforcement or court. Status re counsel set. Court may request test at next hearing date.

Called back from SO 3-31-22 em
